body: There are no (relevant, as far as I can see) changes to the HTML between .11 and .12. I did update Bootstrap from 3.1.1 to 3.3.1 or so, though.

You could try and pinpoint it by downloading the v0.10.12 _binary_ and the v0.10.11 _source_, then running it as `STGUIASSETS=$pathToSource/gui`. That'll run it with the old HTML+bootstrap. Then it's mostly a question of removing files from the source directory until the problem comes back - if they are not present in the STGUIASSETS dir, the compiled in version will be used. The likely candidates are `index.html`, and the stuff in `gui/vendor/bootstrap` I guess... Bonus points for pinpointing the actual breakage. :)
It’s happening for me on MacOS X 10.10, both Chrome 39.0.2171.95 and 41.0.2251.0. When I use Safari 8.0.1, I’m able to check the boxes.
this looks like a Chrome and not a Syncthing problem

Chrome 39 on Ubuntu 14.04 & Windows 7 also have problem...

So I'm still unable to reproduce this with neither Safari nor Chrome on Mac, nor IE and Chrome on Windows 7. Maybe I'm looking for the wrong thing? Are the checkboxes disabled-looking or just nonresponsive? Can someone paste a screenshot or video to illustrate the problem?

They don’t look disabled, but when I hover over the “Ignore Permissions” label, the cursor changes to a hand, and it doesn’t for the device labels. They don’t react to clicks.

![2014-12-18 10_19_00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/43280/5490425/648e0560-869f-11e4-93a3-099934b7df51.gif)

I tried the STGUIASSETS idea [you mentioned above](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/1121#issuecomment-67351989) and the problem disappeared, even when running without the STGUIASSETS variable set. Strange. I’ll try it again, since now the checkboxes aren’t working for me again.

``` don't have the problem with Safari 7.1.2 on OS X 10.9.5 and Firefox 34 on elementary OS Freya.

Okay, using @calmh’s `STGUIASSETS` trick, I’ve narrowed the problem down to the `/gui/vendor/bootstrap` change. When I use 0.10.11’s `/gui/vendor/bootstrap/css/bootstrap.min.css` file, the modal background covers the modal, but if I delete it using the developer tools, I can then check the boxes. When I use 0.10.11’s `/gui/vendor/bootstrap/js/bootstrap.min.js`, the modal background problem disappears, and the boxes are still checkable.

ETA: changing only the Javascript doesn’t fix the problem, so seems like the CSS is the problem. Hmm

Don’t know where to go from there, there are a lot of differences between those files. Seems like something changed in the new Bootstrap version, but I can’t find any known issues, and the non-device check boxes are working fine for me.
Further weirdness: when I change the containing `<div>` class away from `three-columns`, the boxes become accessible.
Right! That narrows it down a bit. I'll see if I can track it down, otherwise revert the bootstrap upgrade.

Yeah I could make no sense of it (but I could reproduce it now, for some reason). With the style `-webkit-columns: 3` and newer bootstrap, the checkboxes become unclickable. They seem to be "behind" a pane of glass or something, because right clicking and "inspect element" selects the containing div instead of the actual checkbox. I've reverted the bootstrap upgrade for the time being, will do a new release to sort this out soon enough.

issue.title: Checkboxes in 3-column layout in GUI are unclickable in Chrome

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Checkboxes inside divs with class `three-columns` are unclickable in Chrome 43 / CEF 3 on Windows.

Disabling the `-webkit-column-count: 3` directive in the `.three-columns` class "fixes" the issue - i.e. makes the checkboxes clickable again.

This affects CEF 3, which was previously working fine, suggesting that it is not a Chrome update which broke this. However, none of the relevant lines in Syncthing's source seem to have changed lately either...

This means that it's impossible to select which devices to share a folder with, and folders to share a device with, in the GUI.

Firefox seems unaffected.

Forum topic: https://forum.syncthing.net/t/problem-after-updating-to-0-11-12/5055

issue.title: Use bootstrap grid instead of column-count:3 for aligning checkboxes (fixes #2029)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Upgrading to bootstrap 3.3.5 meant that checkboxes inside a div with
column-count:3 set would be unclickable in Chrome: in fact, the entire
div appears to sit on top of its contents, making interaction impossible.

This affected both the 'show folder with these devices' and 'these devices
can access this folder' sections of the UI.

I'm not sure what the the underlying cause is, but moving to Bootstrap's
grid system appears work around the issue. Devices/folders have to be
explicitly split out into rows, otherwise the final element appears offset.

To do this grouping by row, a new filter (groupFilter) has been added, which
turns an input of e.g. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] with a groupSize of 3 into
[[1, 2, 3], [4, 5]]. However altering the collection in this way throws
Angular into an infinite watch loop, terminating in infdig. m59peacemaker's
pmkr.filterStabilize (MIT) was added to work around this issue.

This also has the side-effect of wrapping the list of devices/folders
when the screen width decreases.

See also:
- #2027 (bootstrap update which triggered this issue)
- #1121 (last time it happened)
